Ayn Rand's irresistible attraction to the dominance of the 'alpha male,' as embodied by Elon Musk
subhead: 'Musk Fictions' (6/6). Since 2024 and his opportunistic support for Donald Trump, American billionaire Elon Musk has increasingly cited the 20th-century novelist Ayn Rand, the apostle of rational selfishness and capitalism.

Trump demands $1 billion from UCLA over last year's pro-Palestinian protests
subhead: The Trump administration pushed claims of antisemitism in UCLA's response to 2024 student protests related to Gaza. Pro-Palestinian protests rocked dozens of US campuses, with police crackdowns and mob violence erupting over student encampments.

title: Agnès Levallois: 'The war in Gaza is political and has no military rationale'
subhead: In an opinion piece for Le Monde, the vice president of the Institute for Research and Studies on the Mediterranean and the Middle East, analyzes statements by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who has announced his intention to take full control of the Gaza Strip.

title: Maryam, Afghan chef: 'Leaving Afghanistan brought a whirlwind of emotions, not knowing who you are anymore'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (5/6). Maryam left Afghanistan at the age of 13, crossing 11 countries to reach France. Along the way, in Turkey, she discovered kumpir – a stuffed baked potato – which has since become her lucky dish.

title: Longchamp racecourse is 'the place to be' for Paris' gilded youth
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (3/6). At these horse races in Paris' 16th arrondissement, a young crowd shows off their taste for 'old-school' high society events, which are sometimes idealized on social media.

subhead: Whether due to an accident or illness, a major facial alteration can profoundly disrupt one's sense of identity. People who have been disfigured describe the painful processes of reclaiming their lives.

title: 'We are far too eager to entrust the management of the world to AI instead of recognizing its limits'
subhead: Media historian Jérôme Bourdon reminds readers that artificial intelligence is part of a long human history, and questions whether this technological revolution is on the verge of becoming a new religion.

title: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
subhead: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.
